page.title: 03HISTORY OF GLENROTHES
page.content: (CONT) WERE SET ASIDE FOR THIS PURPOSE .AFTER WOODSIDE CAME AUCHMUTY AND THE NEED FOR 2 MAJOR ROADS.ONE WAS THE QUEENSWAY WHICH WOULD CONNECT WITH THE TOWN CENTRE AREA AND FORM THE FIRST PART OF THE NEW A911 CONNECTING WITH LESLIE,INSTEAD OF THE OLD ROUTE BY CADAHM.THE OTHER WAS WOODSIDE ROAD WHICH WOULD FOLLOW ROUGHLY THE OLD WAROUT RIGHT-OF-WAY.THE NEXT AREAS TO BE BUILT WERE RIMBLETON AND SOUTHPARKS WHICH WERE BUILT OVER THE PERIOD FROM 1958-1965.WITH THESE PRECINCTS CAME NEW DESIGNS.THERE WERE CULDESACS, PENDHOUSES AND PEDWAY ROUTES.THERE WERE NOW DIFFERENT OUTSIDE CLADDING MATERIALS WHICH GAVE MORE TEXTURE AND COLOUR TO THE APPEARANCE OF THE HOUSES IN 1955 WORK WAS STARTED ON BUILDING SHOPS IN THE TOWN CENTRE AREA.HOWEVER FOR THE MOMENT WOODSIDE HAD TO BE USED.
